bioghist.p: Clifford M Drury (1897-1894) was an historian and bibliographer of Presbyterian history and history of the Protestant missions of the Pacific Northwest. He was born in Iowa and received his B.D. from San Francisco Theological Seminary in 1922 and Ph.D. from the University of Edinburgh in 1932. He was pastor of churches in California, Shanghai, and Idaho, and a professor of church history at San Francisco Theological Seminary, 1938-1963. From 1944-1956 he was the official historian of the U.S. Navy, Chaplain Corps.

scopecontent.p: This collection contains many volumes of sermons by Drury. There are also published and manuscript copies of Drury's writings, including chapters of his autobiography; diaries with entries from 1938 and 1962-1964, 1968-1979; personal and professional correspondence; some photographs, postcards and artwork from Drury's travels in Asia and other countries and some historical information about the U.S. Navy Chaplain Corps, as well as correspondence and annual reports Drury wrote about his Chaplain activities during World War II. Also included are clippings about Drury and awards; citations; honorary degrees and personal memorabilia (passports, marriage and birth certificates, papers related to his home); tax returns; and one audiocassette from a talk Drury gave in 1981 titled "Following the trail of the Whitman."
